document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

bibRefCitation.author: Wilkinson, D. S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Wilkinson, D. S. (1934) On some Apanteles (Hym. Bracon.). Stylops, 3, 145 - 156. https: // doi. org / 10.1111 / j. 1365 - 3113.1934. tb 01568. x

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles cocotis
Wilkinson, 1934: 152
. Holotype ♀ (examined)— Java , Indonesia [NHM, Fig. 104f ].

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Edge of vannal lobe beyond its widest point without fringe of hairs; penultimate flagellomere one and a third times longer than wide; hind femur reddish yellow; vertex between ocelli and eye-margin, and temples, very shiny, almost smooth; mesoscutum shiny with fine punctures; areolation of propodeum not strong, costulae weak, and more or less absent; metacarp very long, fully 7.0 as long as its distance from apex of marginal cell; r obliquely placed on pterostigma and a well-marked angle between it and 2-SR; T1 strongly narrowed towards apex, shiny and weakly sculptured; wings markedly and evenly darkened; spines along upper part of outer side of hind tibia short, stubby, very dense.
Host. It has been collected in male flower of coconut ( Wilkinson, 1934 ).

Distribution. China ( Fujian , Guangdong , Guangxi , Guizhou , Taiwan , Zhejiang) new record ; Indonesia .
Remarks. Characters of the examined specimens mostly agree with the published description and type specimen, except for the brownish wings ( Fig. 27b ).
